subject: FW: Ride for a Cure - Donation report
preview: Hi Tanja,    Ok no probs 👍   You have a great weekend too.    Thanks,

full_threads.body:
Hi Tanja, 


Ok no probs 👍


You have a great weekend too. 


Thanks,

Hi Heath,


Great, thanks for clarifying!


Have a lovely weekend and speak soon,


Tanja

Hi Tanja, 


We have changed the setup/database for this donation form when we were asked to also include the permission to email both Edward and Tom. So the spreadsheet that Joel previously has all of the donation data to that date and then the method shown in the video will be for all donations received after that date. 


I hope that clarifies and I have reattached the spread sheet for you. Thanks and speak soon,

Hi Heath,


Thank you for taking the time to make the video, I appreciate it.


I followed your exact steps and I can see Joel’s donation to Ed’s page in column AU, that’s all good. My issue is that I can’t see any donations to Ed’s or Tom’s page prior to 27th July as you can see in column AU. Can you please ensure that every donation every made to their pages appears in this report?


Thanks so much,


Tanja



Tanja Voss


Kiss Goodbye to MS Senior Campaign Coordinator


MS Research Australia


02 8413 7919 • 1300 356 467


tvoss@msra.org.au • www.msra.org.au


Level 19 Northpoint • 100 Miller Street • North Sydney NSW 2060

Hi Tanja, 


I have created a quick video to show you where to export these from. We can see that they are appearing on the csv export, Joel did a donation to Edward's page today, it's the first entry at the top of the file. 


https://www.useloom.com/share/264b187998b74663b86772b3d778ed92 


Hope that helps, thanks and speak soon,

Hi Joel,


Thanks for the below!


I just double checked the report and unfortunately column AU still doesn’t include any of the donations which for example came through to Ed Archibalds fundraising page:


https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/fundraiser/edward-archibald/


Can you please work on a solution which includes every single donation and the fundraising team member page the donation has come through?


Thanks so much,


Tanja
FW: Ride for a Cure - Donation report

Hi Tanja,


Please see the attached file for the donation for Edward and Toms. 


Now that we link Edward and Toms Fundraiser to "Ride for a cure" donation we could use the "edm subscribers export"
"https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/wp-admin/admin.php?page=gf_export" and select "Donation Form Version - Ride for a cure"


You can determine which donation it is In "AU" column if its empty it from the "ride for a cure" fundraiser.


Let me know if it make sense? Thanks!


Cheers!

Hi Joel,


Thanks so much for making the below changes, both the links work fine!


Can you please let me know how I can pull this report myself and if this also includes to donations that come through via Ed Archibald’s or Tom Haigh’s fundraising page?


Heath told me last week to pull the report via the EDM subscribers tab in the backend, but I don’t think this includes donations that come through to Ed or Tom’s page?


I need to download this report weekly and it’s important that it includes all donations, can you please confirm this or add them? And can you please add a column to the report which shows which page they donated to?


Thanks so much,


Tanja

Hi Tanja,


We have update our code. We link the team members fundraisers to ride for a cure donation link (https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/fundraiser/ride-for-a-cure/). 


Here's a quick link for you to check.
https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/fundraiser/edward-archibald/
New Donation link - https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/donate-to-ride-for-a-cure/?c=11308
https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/fundraiser/tom-haigh/
New Donation link - https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/donate-to-ride-for-a-cure/?c=16062


I have also attached exported. You can see who checks the "By making this donation I’m giving permission......" on the column "AL"


Let me know if this is correct? Thanks!


Cheers!

Joel Maligalig This is the team page: https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/fundraiser/ride-for-a-cure/ 


Team members are: https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/fundraiser/edward-archibald/
https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/fundraiser/tom-haigh/ 


Both team members need the check box that reads:
By making this donation I’m giving permission to Kiss Goodbye to MS to pass on my contact details to the ‘Ride for a Cure’ team to send me updates in regards to the race kilometre I sponsored
Joel Maligalig for tomorrow morning. Please feel free to respond directly to the client. Cheers
FW: Ride for a Cure - Donation report

Hi Tanja, 


Sure, this is a little involved, but we will tackle this today and get back you tomorrow morning at the latest. 


Thanks and speak soon,
FW: Ride for a Cure - Donation report

Hi Wolf IQ,

Can you please assist with my below enquiry?

The ‘consent’ blurb needs to be added to both the below fundraising pages as soon as possible.

I will also wait to hear from you in regards to the export.

Thanks so much,

Tanja

From: Tanja Voss
Sent: Friday, 22 June 2018 4:57 PM
To: Heath Maguire - Wolf IQ <heath@wolfiq.com.au>
Subject: Ride for a Cure - Donation report

Hi Heath,

We recently spoke about an export for the Ride for a Cure fundraiser and how I’ll need to see in the export who gave permission to be contacted. You suggested that I use the ‘EDM subscribers’ export option, but I noticed this doesn’t include any of the other team members and individual pages which are linked to the team page.

Can you please add a column to the donation export which includes whether or not they ticked the box while donating?

This actually made me realise that we also have to add the following to Ed’s and Tom’s individual donations pages:

https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/fundraiser/edward-archibald/

https://kissgoodbyetoms.org/fundraiser/tom-haigh/

By making this donation I’m giving permission to Kiss Goodbye to MS to pass on my contact details to the ‘Ride for a Cure’ team to send me updates in regards to the race kilometre I sponsored.

Thanks so much,

Tanja

Tanja Voss

Kiss Goodbye to MS Senior Campaign Coordinator

MS Research Australia

02 8413 7919 • 1300 356 467
